name: getPeriodicUpgradePrechecksStatus
description: Get the result of the latest run of the upgrade prechecks.

id.description: ID of the Rubrik cluster or *me* for self.

fetch_next_run_info.description: If specified, fetch information corresponding to next upgrade prechecks job instance. If an upgrade prechecks job instance is currently running, results corresponding to it are returned.

$ul: **endTime**: The Unix epoch timestamp, in milliseconds, corresponding to the end of the last completed upgrade prechecks job instance.
**failureResults**: The results of the failed prechecks. This includes the name of the failed prechecks and details of the error.
**isOnDemand**: Specifies whether this result is from a user-triggered job.
**jobInstanceId**: Identifier corresponding to the currently running or next upgrade prechecks job instance.
**startTime**: The Unix epoch timestamp, in milliseconds, corresponding to the start of the currently running or next upgrade prechecks job instance.
**status**: Status of the currently running or next upgrade prechecks job instance.
**numPrechecksRun**: Total number of upgrade prechecks that were run.
**runPeriodInMinutes**: Time, in minutes, between consecutive runs of scheduled upgrade prechecks job instances.
**startTime**: The Unix epoch timestamp, in milliseconds, corresponding to the start of the last completed upgrade prechecks job instance.
